input:
Share blog: fine-tuning FLUX.1 on my face!

Context:
Although large language models (LLMs) seem to get all the attention these days, image-generation models have been advancing just as rapidly. The current state-of-the-art is FLUX.1, an image model from Black Forest Labs (a faction from the Stable Diffusion team). In this article, I share the full process I used for fine-tuning this model to generate unlimited high-quality photos of myself.
writing_steps:
Step 1: Purpose & Audience
- Purpose: Share Shaw's new blog post about fine-tuning the FLUX.1 image model on his own face, and educate readers about state-of-the-art image-generation models.
- Audience: Technical creators, AI enthusiasts, and anyone curious about generative AI (including LLM/AI users who might not have explored image models much).

Step 2: Wireframe
- Hook: LLMs get all the buzz, but image models are moving just as fast...
- Meat: Quick intro to FLUX.1 and why it's exciting. Briefly tease the personal project: fine-tuning to create high-quality photos of myself. Mention that the article walks through the full process and what you can expect to learn.
- CTA: "Curious how I did it? Check out the full walkthrough."
- (Link to blog before CTA)

Step 3: Meat
Although LLMs dominate the headlines, image-generation models have quietly reached a whole new level.

One standout: FLUX.1 from Black Forest Labs (some of the same minds behind Stable Diffusion). It's one of the most advanced image synthesis models available today.

Recently, I dove in and fine-tuned FLUX.1—on my own face.

The result? Unlimited, high-fidelity images of myself, generated in any style I could imagine.

I documented the entire workflow—from data prep and model choice to sample outputs—in my latest blog post.

Step 4: CTA
Curious how I did it? Check out the full walkthrough.

Step 5A: Hook Directions
- [Trend/urgency] "LLMs get all the buzz, but image models are evolving just as quickly."
- [Personal story] "I fine-tuned a state-of-the-art model—to generate unlimited photos of myself."
- [Beginner-to-expert clarity] "Think LLMs are the only exciting thing in AI? Think again."
- [Tool/tech spotlight] "Meet FLUX.1: the new frontier in image-generation models."

Step 5B: Notes
- [Trend/urgency] Contrasting AI trends. "Everyone focuses on LLMs, but image models quietly reach new heights."
- [Personal story] Novelty of making endless high-quality selfies with AI.
- [Beginner-to-expert clarity] Demystifying the cutting edge of image AI.
- [Tool/tech] "What sets FLUX.1 apart?"

Step 5C: Final Hook
LLMs get all the attention, but image-generation models are quietly catching up—and doing some wild things.

Step 6: Draft Post
LLMs get all the attention, but image-generation models are quietly catching up—and doing some wild things.

Case in point: FLUX.1 from Black Forest Labs (yes, the folks behind Stable Diffusion).

This week, I decided to fine-tune FLUX.1—on my own face.

Why? To see if I could generate unlimited, high-quality photos of myself in any style I could imagine (just for fun, and a bit of science).

I walked through the full process in my latest blog post:

- How the workflow works
- What makes FLUX.1 unique
- What I learned (with plenty of examples)

Read the full breakdown here: [LINK]

Curious how I did it? Check out the walkthrough.

Step 7: Style & Voice Review
- Direct, clear, and technical but approachable tone
- No assumption of results or detail beyond what is provided
- No more than one em dash
- Teases why FLUX.1 matters, but doesn't invent details
- Good white space and scannability
- Only one CTA

Step 8: Final Post
final_post:
LLMs get all the attention, but image-generation models are quietly catching up—and doing some wild things.

Case in point: FLUX.1 from Black Forest Labs (same folks behind Stable Diffusion).

I recently fine-tuned FLUX.1 on my own face. Now I can generate unlimited, high-quality photos of myself in any style I want.
